summary: During my master's thesis, I discovered my passion for researching and solving complex problems with real-world applications. With a Master’s degree from Eindhoven University of Technology, I have a strong foundation in computer science and engineering. As a project manager, I successfully guided a team of 10 students, demonstrating my leadership capabilities. Moreover, my experience as a student assistant allowed me to help students understand and explore the fundamental concepts of physics, aiding their comprehension of physics and engineering. Now, I am eager to transition into a career in the software engineering field where I can further enhance my skills and contribute to cutting-edge advancements. If you're seeking a motivated professional with a passion for research, problem-solving, development and working on the forefront of innovation, feel free to reach out to me.

school.name: Notre Dame de Sion French High School

profile_positions.description:
Master Thesis Project, ASML and ESI (TNO) collaboration.

Actionable insights from software behavior model comparisons for software changes in high-tech systems - Preventing regressions while maintaining software changes is notoriously challenging. Software developers typically compare execution logs obtained from system runs to detect, mitigate or prevent software regressions. However this is error-prone and time consuming since the amount of logs to investigate can be substantial and they can produce irrelevant differences which makes it difficult to isolate the useful and redundant differences. One of the methods that has been proposed to help developers comprehend system behavior differences is to infer state machine models of the system behaviors and compare them at the model level. Even though comparing models locates differences in system behavior, it does not relate these differences with one another. Without such relations, software developers still need to invest considerable time and effort to comprehend the differences. Providing software developers with actionable insights such as relations of system behavior differences reduces the amount of the manual investigation required. In this work, we contribute a framework to automatically capture and visualize relations of behavior differences between state machine models for two versions of the same software. Furthermore, we provide a solid formal foundation by defining relations of behavior differences at different levels of granularity. To conclude the study, we demonstrate the feasibility of the framework on a case study and validate usability of the results with the ASML experts.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Project

profile_positions.description:
-Software Engineering Project Manager
In the course Software Project Management, each student assistant learns about managing real-life software projects in practice as well as in theory. The theoretical aspects can be summarized as: schedule planning, progress tracking, and agile/scrum management methods. For the practical side of the course student assistants guide a team of 10 bachelor students during their final graduation project (SEP). The team must develop a moderately sized software for a real-life customer with the proper documentation.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

profile_positions.description:
-Applied natural sciences conceptual
Helping students with practical questions on the fundamental concepts of physics so they can form a founded idea of both scientific and technological developments in engineering fields.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant

profile_positions.description: Developed an advanced production monitoring dashboard for the HORSE project as part of the EU Horizon 2020 initiative.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer

profile_positions.description: I joined the Engineering team in Wireless Access Technology. I participated in the development and testing of NETSIA's wireless network solution where I learned the main building blocks of 4G/LTE Network Slicing architecture and development for wireless networking.
profile_positions.title: Intern
